story:
A few years ago, mum had met someone who finally made her happy. He doted her and made her feel like a queen. 

He had many battles in his life that he won, but his last battle was a big one, one he couldn't win. 

My step dad Gordon was diagnosed with Pancreatic cancer in early 2017 and was told he only had 2 to 4 weeks to live. 

He really did put up a fight and stayed strong for as long as he possibly could. 

4 weeks later, sadly, he could no longer fight and decided it was time to rest. 

During his treatment, Macmillan nurses came to see him every day. Answered the 1001 questions my mum had, supported her as much as Gordon and made sure he was as comfortable as possible. 

The amazing work done by these angels has provided comfort to many families going through the pain of losing someone they love. 

Without them, my mum would have struggled to cope with the process. 

So please donate what you can, every single penny counts.
